content:
EUROPE, SCIENCE, ART AND ALIENS--HW 3

About Jordan Cole

Name: Jordan Cole
E-mail: eafu233@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Theatre Arts w/Scenic Design interest

Three neat Web finds:

  1. University of Kansas's HTML Quick Reference shows the novice HTML programmer the basic tricks of the trade.
  2. ANIMA is a wonderful way to tap into the current artistic world.
  3. Yahoo-A Guide to WWW is a killer app. that gives you a world of info at the click of a button.

Questions I can now answer
  • What is the relationship between HTML and SGML?
  • What recent UFO sightings have occured in Europe?
  • What kind of person was Vincent van Gogh and what movement in modern art did he influence?
  • What do critics have to say about Broadway's production of Love! Valor! Compassion! and what's its relation to Shakespeare?
  • What popular European applications are available via telnet ?

  • What is relationship between HTML and SGML?

     As found in James Powell's Introduction to HTML, HTML (Hypertext Markup Language)is just one application of SGML that is used to "mark-up" web documents. Both HTML and SGML were invented by Tim Berners-Lee of CERN. In fact, Hypertext Markup Language states that HTML is a generalized SGML language that can be used for a wide variety of applications.

    Return to list of questions.

  • What recent UFO sightings have occured in Europe?

     According to Summary Report of Belgian UFO Activity, the MC of the Air Defense radar station of Glons, Belgium, got a phone call from a person swearing they saw three separate, brightly blinking lights in the clear sky above (and they were changing colors, too!) Within the depths of an obscure Rutgers Page, an employee of England's Jodrell Bank Observatory claimed to have scanned a strange craft flying at unearthy speeds in the 1950's. Unfortunately, over the period of human recorded history, the limited martian activity that has taken place in Europe has been catagorized into superstition and folklore.

    Return to list of questions.

  • What kind of person what Vincent van Gogh and what movement in modern art did he influence?

     Vincent van Gogh was an immense influence on the coming of modern art's post-expressionism, as can be noted in his work within Le WebLouvre, Paris. Vincent was also noted to be a great influence on Fauvism. In his personal life, Van Gogh was tormented by his lack of unrequitted love for both women and Christ, but he had a loving brother that funded his artistic pursuits. Through the course of his short ten years as an artist, Vincent managed to produce 800 paintings and an equal amount of sketches/renderings.

    Return to list of questions.

  • What do critics have to say about Broadway's production of Love! Valour! Compassion! and what's its relation to Shakespeare?

    Although the show has only been running for a little over a month at The Walter Kerr Theatre (at 219 West 48th Street), the critics are confident about its ability to entertain. As listed at Love!, Michael Kuchwara of the Associated Press felt the play to be "Heartfelt and Stirring". Evoking similiar emotion is a catalogue of 37 plays that Bill Shakespeare set into history over 400 years ago. Each year, Shakespeare Santa Cruz displays a modernized but still terrific rendition of two Shakespeare classics.

    Return to list of questions.

  • What popular European applications are available via telnet?

    There are several server sights available through telnet, that just happen to be located in a few obscure regions of Europe. By tapping into the Guide to Cyberspace, a few of these options will become available. (Watch for that Slovakian connection, though--you may have to wait until your next birthday before it's finished downloading). For something most interesting and exciting, you may want to dive into On-line Job Services offered through Telnet Services. Go ahead and click onto NISS, and you'll be given the NISS GATEWAY MAIN MENU, through which you can find an array of information and employment opportunities in the UK and neighboring university departments.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted January 30, 1995 for ICS 1C
